title: Ike "The Spike" Stadtler
dialogue: "Squeeze his hand off!" - The Arm

title: Hutch & Chantal
gameText: During the LONG RANGE COMBAT round, for every two cards discarded from your hand, increase Hutch & Chantal's LRC by 1.
dialogue: "That douchebag is really pissing me off!" - Chantal

title: Leland Palmer
gameText: Leland Palmer's LRC and CRC values are each equal to the number of Agents in the Team currently investigating this Site.
dialogue: "Your hands are filthy... look, there is dirt way under this fingernail." - Leland Palmer

title: The Experiment
gameText: The Experiment engages two opposing Agents (your choice) in Combat.
dialogue: "I'm supposed to watch the box and see if anything appears inside." - Sam Colby

title: The Woodsmen, Sentinels of the Black Lodge
gameText: At the beginning of each combat round you may discard 2 [CP] from your [CP] pool to heal 1 point of damage to the Woodsmen. The LONG RANGE COMBAT round is skipped.
dialogue: "Got a Light?" - Woodman

title: Mr. C, The Shadow of Cooper
gameText: Mr. C's LRC, CRC and HEALTH values become equal to those of any one Agent in the target Team (your choice), until the end of this Combat. Move that Agent to the Hospital with 0 HEALTH. Mr. C attacks the remaining Agents in a normal Combat sequence that lasts one LRC and one CRC round.
dialogue: "What brings you back to Twin Peaks, Agent Cooper?" - Sheriff Truman

title: Windom Earle, Seeker of the Black Lodge
gameText: If this Adversary's HEALTH is reduced to 0 during Combat, you may immediately play an Adversary card with a cost less than 5 from your discard pile, ignoring Activator requirements, at its normal cost. That Adversary immediately begins a normal Combat with the Team.
dialogue: "If you give me your soul, I'll let Annie live." - Windom Earle

title: Bob, The Possessing Spirit
gameText: This card does not initiate combat now. Attach Bob to any one Agent in the Team at this Site (your choice). Place both cards next to your X-File. On your next turn as Directed player after your opponent plays their next Site card, that Agent must attack any one of your opponent's Teams in the Field, ignoring Activator requirements. Remove Bob and return the Agent to your opponent's Field after the combat.
dialogue: "Maybe that's all Bob is. The evil that men do." - Albert Rosenfield

title: Jake & Gene, The Snippers Alliance
gameText: The chosen Agent is the only one who may participate in the Combat. Jake & Gene may use MARTIAL ARTS and SUBTERFUGE cards. Your opponent may pay 4 [RP] to force you to discard this card.
dialogue: "Oh my God! Gene, he's not in the car!" - Jake

title: Josie Packard
gameText: Josie Packard may attack only one Agent (your choice) in one round of LONG RANGE and one CLOSE RANGE COMBAT. All other Agents in the Team also participate in the Combat and may assign damage to Josie as normal.
dialogue: "Why did you shoot me, Josie?" - Cooper

title: Hank Jennings, The Foreign Outlaw
gameText: At the end of this Combat, if Hank's HEALTH has not been reduced to zero, you may play him at another Site controlled by the same opponent this turn at no cost and ignoring Activator requirements. If no such Site exists, discard this card.
dialogue: "Oh, Ed, the things we do for love." - Hank Jennings

title: Detective Dave Macklay
gameEffect: Detective Dave Macklay gains +1 OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill if he is in a Team with an Agent who has the BELIEVER Keyword or OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill.
bio: Detective Dave Macklay investigated Ruth Davenport's murder, linking fingerprints to Bill Hastings. He coordinated with the FBI uncovering connections to alternate dimensions and Major Garland Briggs. Macklay witnessed bizarre phenomena, including Hastings' death, and confirmed the presence of mysterious, shadowy figures nearby.

title: Agent Sam Stanley
gameEffect: If Agent Sam Stanley is in the same Team as Agent Chester Desmond, they both gain a +1 to their cumulative MEDICAL skill, and a -1 to their OBSERVATION skill..
bio: Sam Stanley, an FBI forensic pathologist, assisted Agent Chester Desmond in investigating Teresa Banks' murder. He discovered a key clue under her fingernail and transported the body to Portland. After Desmond's disappearance, Stanley suffered a personal breakdown.

title: Agent Chester Desmond
gameEffect: Place a token on this card. You may discard that token to search your Bureau deck for an Equipment card with the MYSTIC Keyword. Add it to your hand, then reshuffle your Bureau deck.
bio: hester Desmond was an FBI Special Agent and founding member of the Blue Rose Task Force. He investigated Teresa Banks' murder and mysteriously disappeared after finding a ring under a trailer, leading Dale Cooper to take over the case.

title: Major Garland Briggs
gameEffect: If a Team including Garland Briggs is attacked by a PRIMORDIAL or an OCCULT Adversary, you may choose to engage only Garland Briggs with that Adversary. After the Combat, discard the Adversary card.
bio: Major Garland Briggs was a principled U.S. Air Force officer who oversaw a secret paranormal research site in Twin Peaks. Committed to truth and duty, he aided Agent Cooper against supernatural threats and sacrificed himself battling evil beyond our world.

title: Forensic Specialist Albert Rosenfield
gameEffect: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token to play any Keyword MEDICAL or SCIENCES card for zero cost.
bio: Albert Rosenfield, a brilliant yet cynical FBI forensic specialist, assisted Agent Cooper in the Laura Palmer investigation and later in the Blue Rose case. Despite his sharp tongue, he believed in peace, rejecting violence and embracing love as his guiding principle.

title: Deputy Director Gordon Cole
gameEffect: Place 1 [RP] on this card. This may be used to pay for any Keyword BUREAUCRACY, LIMINAL or OCCULT INVESTIGATION cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
bio: Gordon Cole is a veteran FBI agent and head of the Blue Rose Task Force. Known for his sharp instincts and partial deafness, he leads investigations into paranormal phenomena, including the mystery of Dale Cooper's disappearance and return. Loyal and fearless.

title: Agent Dale Cooper
gameEffect: Place three tokens on Agent Dale Cooper. Once per turn, during a skill check, you may remove one token to add +1 to Agent Cooper's OBSERVATION, OCCULT INVESTIGATION, or SUBTERFUGE skill.
bio: FBI profiler with uncanny intuition and dream-guided insights. Obsessed with coffee, truth, and inner balance, Cooper relies on sharp observational skills to uncover hidden clues, interpreting them through instinct, symbolism, and dreams. A brilliant mind navigating the unknown with  calm precision..

title: FBI Chief of Staff Denise Bryson
gameEffect: Place a token on this card. Discard a token to move Agent Dale Cooper from anywhere on the table to the Team Denise Bryson is in. Cooper may assist in any skill check made by the team. In this manner, Cooper may assist on two Sites in one turn.
bio: Denise Bryson began her career as an undercover DEA agent, working with Dale Cooper on high-risk missions. After embracing her identity as a woman, she rose through the FBI ranks with distinction, eventually becoming Chief of Staff for the Bureau.

title: Agent Roger Hardy
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Discard one token to choose one Agent controlled by an opponent. Add that Agent to Hardy's Team during one Site investigation. Afterward, return the Agent to the Team it belonged or to the Hospital if the Agent was reduced to 0 HEALTH during combat.
bio: Roger Hardy was an FBI Internal Affairs agent who temporarily suspended Dale Cooper due to concerns about his actions in Canada. He questioned Cooper's conduct, requested his badge and gun, and informed him that the DEA and Canadian authorities would proceed.

title: Agent Tammy Preston
gameEffect: Agent Tammy Preston's BUREAUCRACY and OCCULT INVESTIGATION skills are increased by one if he Deputy Director Gordon Cole are on the same Team.
bio: Tamara "Tammy" Preston is a brilliant FBI agent recruited into the Blue Rose Task Force. She investigated Agent Dale Cooper's return, analyzed paranormal dossiers, and uncovered timeline anomalies. Her sharp insight and loyalty to Gordon Cole defined her pivotal role in Twin Peaks.

title: Agent Phillip Jeffries
gameEffect: Place two tokens on Phillip Jeffries. Once per turn, during the Briefing phase, you may discard one token to double the RES value of any Agent in play (not in the Hospital). Add the additional RES to your Resource Pool.
bio: FBI agent and Blue Rose director, Jeffries vanished in Buenos Aires. Obsessed with ‘Judy' and dark forces, he reappeared briefly before transforming into a non-corporeal, time-bending entity operating from a hidden location known as the Dutchman's.

title: Don Harrison
gameEffect: If Detective Don Harrison is in the same Team as Detective Dave Macklay, they both gain a +1 to their cumulative COMPUTER and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills, and a -1 to their OBSERVATION and SCIENCES skills..
bio: Detective Don Harrison of the South Dakota State Police investigated the mysterious murder of Ruth Davenport. He questioned William Hastings and, alongside Detective Dave Macklay, uncovered a piece of flesh in Hastings' car and a ring hidden inside a decapitated corpse.

title: No Loose Ends
gameText: Play any Adversary card from your Discard Pile for 2 [CP] less, ignoring Activator requirements.
dialogue: "Ike, you're under arrest for attempted murder. We have your palm print." - Detectives Fusco

title: The Black Ace
gameText: Play 3 [CP] to move up to 4 [RP] from your opponent's [RP] pool to your [CP] pool immediately.
dialogue: "Did you ever see anything like this? This is what I want." - Mr. C

title: Dark Ritual
episode: Zen, or the Skill to Catch a Killer
gameText: Play to add 7 [CP] to your [CP] pool immediately.
dialogue: "Catch you with my dead bag. You may think that I've gone insane... but I promise, I will kill again." - Bob

title: One From the Deck
gameText: You may search your Bureau deck for an Adversary card with a printed cost of six or less, reveal it, and play it immediately at half its cost (rounded up) ignoring Activator requirements. Then shuffle your deck.
dialogue: "Oh! and I know you got to die. A royal execution." - Windom Earle

title: Out of Her Mind
gameText: Play on a Team investigating a Site to send an Event RESOURCE controlled by that Team's controller to the Discard pile.
dialogue: "Did you take all of that today?" - Becky Burnett

title: The Ultimate Secret
gameText: Play this card to look at the top six cards of your opponent's Bureau deck. Choose and discard three of them, then return the rest to the top of their deck in any order.
dialogue: "Do you know what the ultimate secret is? Do you want to know... what Laura did?" - Harold Smith

title: One Last Performance
gameText: Play to negate one card with the Keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION or EVIDENCE COLLECTION.
dialogue: Cooper:"Did you kill Laura Palmer?". Leland:"Whooo!!! Whoo-whoo! Hoo-hoo-hoo!! Whooo!!! Whooo! Hoo-Hoo!"

title: To Weak to Matter
gameText: Play on any Team investigating a Site. Only Agents with a base value of 5 or more [RP] may contribute to that Site skill check.
dialogue: "If you know what's good for you, and you do, don't move." - Bob

title: Psychic Torture
episode: The Path to the Black Lodge
gameText: Play on one Agent to decrease all their skills by two (except for LRC, CRC, HEALTH and RES) for each [RP] card attached to that Agent. No skill may be reduced below zero. This card is removed once that Agent's Team successfully investigates a Site.
dialogue: "Major, I admire your fortitude." - Windom Earle

title: Laura Palmer's Secret Diary
gameText: Adds two to the Agent's BEHAVIORAL and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills. You cannot sell this card during the Briefing Phase to gain [CP] points,
dialogue: "What we have taped to the page here is a plastic envelope containing a white residue and what looks to be a key to a safety deposit box." - Cooper

title: Laura Palmer's Postmortem Report
gameText: Adds two to the Agent's SCIENCES and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills. You cannot sell this card during the Briefing phase to gain [CP] points,
dialogue: "Time of death estimated to be between midnight and four AM. What killed her was loss of blood. Numerous shallow wounds, no single one serious enough to have caused death." - Dr. Hayward

title: Owl Cave Ring
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent and immediately remove that Agent from play. At the start of the Briefing Phase on your next turn, return the Agent to the Field with this card still attached. That Agent gains +2 to their OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill
dialogue: "Don't take the ring, Laura... Don't take the ring." - Cooper

title: Green Rubber Glove
gameText: Adds three to the Agent's CLOSE RANGE COMBAT skill.
dialogue: "Your right hand will then possess the power of an enormous pile driver." - Freddie Sykes

title: Bureau's Radio Console
gameText: Once per turn, during the Case Assignment Phase, if the Agent equipped with this card is in the Bureau, you may pay 2 [RP] tokens to draw the top two cards of your Bureau deck and add them to your hand.
dialogue: "What's your emergency?" - Maggie Brown

title: Cave Exploration Kit
gameText: Adds two to the Agent's OBSERVATION and SUBTERFUGE skills. You cannot sell this card during the Briefing phase to gain [CP] points
dialogue: "Then a descent to a cool, subterranean cave may be just what the doctor ordered." - Cooper

title: Panasonic RN-105 Tape Recorder
gameText: Adds 1 to the Agent's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills
dialogue: "Voice activated, Harry. When the bird talks maybe we'll get some answers." - Cooper
